name: as
description: as specifies an alias for an import
example: import com.intellij.psi.PsiFile as PF

name: as
description: as is used for type casts
example: val bla = "Hello" as CharSequence

name: as?
description: as? is used for safe type casts
example: "Hello" as? Int == null

name: break
description: break terminates the execution of a loop

name: class
description: class declares a class

name: continue
description: continue proceeds to the next step of the nearest enclosing loop

name: do
description: do begins a do/while loop (loop with postcondition)

name: else
description: else defines the branch of an if expression which is executed when the condition is false

name: false
description: false specifies the 'false' value of the Boolean type
example: 5 < 2 == false

name: for
description: for begins a for loop

name: fun
description: fun declares a function

name: if
description: if begins an if expression

name: in
description: in specifies the object being iterated in a for loop

name: in
description: in is used as an infix operator to check that a value belongs to a range, a collection or another entity that defines the 'contains' method
example: println("foo" in listOf("foo", "bar"))  // true

name: in
description: in marks a type parameter as contravariant

name: !in
description: !in is used as an operator to check that a value does NOT belong to a range, a collection or another entity that defines the 'contains' method
example: println("hey" !in listOf("foo", "bar"))  // true

name: interface
description: interface declares an interface

name: is
description: is checks that a value has a certain type
example:
val foo = "Hello"
println(foo is String)  // true

name: !is
description: !is checks that a value does NOT have a certain type
example:
val foo = "Hello"
println(foo !is Int)  // true

name: null
description: null is a constant representing an object reference that doesn't point to any object
example:
val foo: String? = null
println(foo == null)  // true

name: object
description: object declares a class and its instance at the same time

name: package
description: package specifies the package for the current file
example: package com.intellij.lang.documentation

name: return
description: return returns from the nearest enclosing function or anonymous function

name: super
description: super refers to the superclass implementation of a method or property or calls the superclass constructor from a secondary constructor

name: this
description: this refers to the current receiver or calls another constructor of the same class from a secondary constructor

name: throw
description: throw throws an exception
example: throw IllegalArgumentException("You cannot do this here")

name: true
description: true specifies the 'true' value of the Boolean type
example: 5 > 2 == true

name: try
description: try begins an exception handling block

name: typealias
description: typealias declares a type alias
example: typealias Action<T> = (msg: String) -> T

name: typeof
description: typeof reserved for future use

name: val
description: val declares a read-only property or local variable
example:
val foo = "Hello World"
foo = "Something else"  // Error: foo is read-only

name: var
description: var declares a mutable property or local variable
example:
var foo = "Hello World"
foo = "Something else"

name: when
description: when begins a when expression (executes one of the given branches)

name: while
description: while begins a while loop (loop with precondition)

name: by
description: by delegates the implementation of an interface to another object
example: class Foo(val values: List<Int>): List<Int> by values

name: by
description: by delegates the implementation of accessors for a property to another object
example: val count by lazy { countItems() }

name: catch
description: catch begins a block that handles a specific exception type

name: constructor
description: constructor declares a primary or secondary constructor

name: delegate
description: delegate is used as an annotation use-site target
example:
@delegate:Foo
val foo by lazy { 42 }

name: dynamic
description: dynamic references a dynamic type in Kotlin/JS code
example: val bla: dynamic = doSomething()  // Type-Checker is turned off (JavaScript)

name: field
description: field is used as an annotation use-site target
example:
@field:Foo
val bla = 42

name: file
description: file is used as an annotation use-site target
example: @file:JvmName("Example")  // Names the file

name: finally
description: finally begins a block that is always executed when a try block exits

name: get
description: get declares the getter of a property
example: val value get() = 40 + 2

name: get
description: get is used as an annotation use-site target
example:
@get:Foo
val foo get() = 42

name: import
description: import imports a declaration from another package into the current file
example: import org.jetbrains.kotlin.idea.KotlinLanguage

name: init
description: init begins an initializer block

name: param
description: param is used as an annotation use-site target
example:
@param:Foo
val foo = 0  // Annotates param in constructor

name: property
description: property is used as an annotation use-site target
example:
@property:Foo
val foo = 0  // Not visible in Java

name: receiver
description: receiver is used as an annotation use-site target
example: fun @receiver:Foo String.bar() = 42

name: set
description: set declares the setter of a property
example:
var text: String = ""
  set(value) { field = value + " World" }

name: set
description: set is used as an annotation use-site target
example:
@set:Foo
var foo: Int = 0 set(value) { field = value + 1 }

name: setparam
description: setparam is used as an annotation use-site target
example:
@setparam:Foo
var foo: Int = 0 set(value) { field = value + 1 }

name: value
description: value with the class keyword declares an inline class
example:
@JvmInline
value class UInt(val x: Int)

name: where
description: where specifies constraints for a generic type parameter
example: external fun <T> bla(a: T): Int where T: CharSequence, T: Comparable<T>

name: actual
description: actual denotes a platform-specific implementation in multiplatform projects
example: actual fun bla() = 42  // Implementation for: expect fun bla(): Int

name: abstract
description: abstract marks a class or member as abstract

name: annotation
description: annotation declares an annotation class
example: annotation class Foo(val param: String)

name: companion
description: companion declares a companion object

name: const
description: const marks a property as a compile-time constant
example: const val bla = "Hello World"

name: crossinline
description: crossinline forbids non-local returns in a lambda passed to an inline function
example: inline fun bla(crossinline a: () -> Unit) = a()

name: data
description: data instructs the compiler to generate canonical members for a class
example: data class Foo(val i: Int, val t: String)

name: enum
description: enum declares an enumeration

name: expect
description: expect marks a declaration as platform-specific, expecting an implementation in platform modules.
example: expect fun bla(): Int  // Implementation: actual fun bla() = 42

name: external
description: external marks a declaration as implemented not in Kotlin (accessible through JNI or in JavaScript)
example: external fun bla(): Int

name: final
description: final forbids overriding a member

name: infix
description: infix allows calling a function in infix notation
example: infix fun add(a: Int, b: Int) = a + b

name: inline
description: inline tells the compiler to inline the function and the lambdas passed to it at the call site
example: inline fun <reified T: Any> foo(a: T) = a::class

name: inner
description: inner allows referring to the outer class instance from a nested class

name: internal
description: internal marks a declaration as visible in the current module
example: internal val bla = 42

name: lateinit
description: lateinit allows initializing a non-null property outside of a constructor
example: lateinit var bla: String

name: noinline
description: noinline turns off inlining of a lambda passed to an inline function
example: inline fun bla(noinline a: () -> Unit) = a()

name: open
description: open allows subclassing a class or overriding a member
example: open class Foo {}

name: operator
description: operator marks a function as overloading an operator or implementing a convention
example: operator fun String.minus(a: Int) = this.toInt() - a

name: out
description: out marks a type parameter as covariant

name: override
description: override marks a member as an override of a superclass member
example: override fun bla() = 42

name: private
description: private marks a declaration as visible in the current class or file
example: private fun bla() = 42

name: protected
description: protected marks a declaration as visible in the current class and its subclasses
example: protected fun bla() = 42

name: public
description: public marks a declaration as visible anywhere
example: public fun bla() = 42  // Default is public

name: reified
description: reified marks a type parameter of an inline function as accessible at runtime
example: inline fun <reified T: Any> foo(a: T) = a::class

name: sealed
description: sealed declares a sealed class (a class with restricted subclassing)
example:
sealed interface Foo
class Bar : Foo

name: suspend
description: suspend marks a function or lambda as suspending (usable as a coroutine)
example: suspend fun foo() = doAnotherSuspendTask()

name: tailrec
description: tailrec marks a function as tail-recursive (allowing the compiler to replace recursion with iteration)
example: tailrec fun foo(a: Int): Int = if (a >= 10) a else foo(a + 1)

name: vararg
description: vararg allows passing a variable number of arguments for a parameter
example:
// sum(1, 2, 3, 4)
fun sum(vararg a: Int) = a.sum()
